definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: That's because people want fancy new gadgets now.
sentences.chinese: 因为人们现在喜欢新奇的小玩意。

sentences.english: Entire design embodies the culture Smriti but the originality is unconventional.
sentences.chinese: 整个设计表现文化地传承而新奇别致。

sentences.english: Dynamic energy exudes off the skin as the elements of exotica let us join in.
sentences.chinese: 动态能量散发出掉皮肤新奇的元素，让我们加入。

sentences.english: Have you ever seen the novel "words carved on the rice"?
sentences.chinese: 新奇的“米上刻字”，你见过吗？

sentences.english: And you can do good shopping there for quirky things.
sentences.chinese: 你可以买到新奇的东西。

sentences.english: Every day was exciting and adventuresome.
sentences.chinese: 每天都充满刺激和新奇。

sentences.english: All of a sudden there was nail enamel in these strange colors.
sentences.chinese: 她突然之间拥有很多新奇色彩的指甲油。

sentences.english: Deployment to a foreign country to wage a war entails newness to the nth degree.
sentences.chinese: 部署到外国去打仗导致了他们极大的新奇感。

sentences.english: Yamada said.'Some novel approaches need to be tried.
sentences.chinese: 需要尝试一些新奇的手段。

sentences.english: The novelty of her surrounding soon wore off.
sentences.chinese: 环境的新奇感很快就淡化了。

sentences.english: Sometimes we do get caught up in the new-fangled things and we forget the basics.
sentences.chinese: 有时我们的确是对新奇的东西感兴趣而忘记了基础。

sentences.english: read up on a delicious new sexual technique, then practice on your sweetie.
sentences.chinese: 钻研新的新奇的性爱技巧，并与爱人一起实践。

sentences.english: This is simply because the differences are novel and interesting.
sentences.chinese: 这个道理很简单，因为，“不同”总是新奇有趣的。

sentences.english: Such impressions must be entertainingly novel to the civilized person.
sentences.chinese: 这些印象对文明人说来，准是新奇得引人入胜的。

sentences.english: Many children send their largest, fanciest cards to their parents and teachers.
sentences.chinese: 许多孩子送最大，最新奇的卡片给他们的父母和老师。

sentences.english: And they specialise in selling overpriced novelty goods, really.
sentences.chinese: 他们专营高价的新奇的商品，真的。

definition: lit. new bud/fig. new and original
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
to be playful/to be fond of one's fun
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
to hunt for novelty/to seek novelty
